newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania sees foreign interest in local minerals.
newsitem.headline: Albania sees foreign interest in local minerals.

text.p: Albanian Energy and Mining Minister Abdyl Xhaja said on Wednesday increasing numbers of foreign companies were interested in investing in mineral exploration in Albania.

"There is a growing number of firms wishing to discover new geological resources in unexplored areas and they are also applying new technology in areas under exploration," Xhaja told a news conference. "Geology is a new and most promising field."

Xhaja, whose eight-month-old ministry covers the mining, oil and electricity sectors, also hailed a discovery by Canada's Nebex Resources of several minerals in Albania which could be exploited industrially.
"(Nebex) has invested $1.8 million so far," Xhaja said.
He added Nebex had discovered nickel resources in the northern towns of Surroj and Nojen and was looking for gold in Kacinar, in the north, and Radomire, in the northeast.
Xhaja said Albania had signed two contracts in July with other Canadian companies, which planned to invest $16 million in improved technology over a four-year period.
He said other companies were evaluating nickel silicate and iron-nickel resources in the eastern Albanian areas of Korce and Pogradec.

"Initial results are encouraging and next year things might get to the second stage where technological tests could be carried out in a pilot scheme with a production capacity of 500-8,000 tonnes a year of nickel," he added.
